description: Keeps quitting/segfaults on Debian Stable. Think I'll go back to using my distros version even if versioned behind. It'll just work.

I've got around 20 rooms between 3 servers and HexChat makes it easy to keep track of them all. Its built-in flag controls make it that much easier to be an effective OP in multiple rooms. A true successor to xChat.
I'm not an experienced irc user but with this app everything was easy at the beginning. The gui has some problems but is very functional and easy.

Hexchat is easy to use, pretty versatile, and supports enough shortcuts that I don't often have to actually use a mouse while I'm in it. Between the scripting system, the neat UI and the fact that it seems to work without any fuss, I think it's a good idea to upgrade from XChat.
summary: It's like if XChat were even better

description: One of the best free IRC clients out there. Very easy to setup, has all QoL features you would need such as auto-join and auto-identify.
If you need an IRC client that just works, i think this is more than sufficient. Simple, and never crashed on me.

I switched to hexchat when xchat stopped getting updates, switched to xchat from AmIRC when I stopped using my Amiga as a daily driver... so I've basically been using the same client since the before broadband.

This comes with the python 3 plugin BTW which good for me as that's my scripting language of choice.
summary: Simple to use but easy enough to add features through scripting

ta buena, solo necesito amigos para conversar

Après pas mal d'essai sur d'autres client IRC pour me connecter à une 100ène de canaux IRC en même temps, Hexchat est sans conteste celui qui répond au mieux à mes besoins, il est extensible par plugins si nécessaire, son interface est riche mais reste visuellement ordonnée, les pseudonymes colorés sont un atout, à essayer.
C'est l'un des meilleurs, manque un peu de "graph" pour les smiley par exemple si on voulait le rendre plus "user friendly", mais bon... IRC c'est IRC hein.
